New Records: Shohei Ohtani became the first 50/50 player in MLB history, with 51 home runs and 51 stolen bases.
Ohtani set the record for most total bases (17) and RBIs (10) by a leadoff hitter in a single game.
Ohtani's 17 total bases and 10 RBIs are the most ever for a leadoff hitter in one game.
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani went 6-for-6 with three home runs, two doubles, 10 RBIs, and two stolen bases in the Dodgers' 20-4 win at Miami.
Pre-Game Insights: There was speculation surrounding Ohtani's potential to become the first 50/50 player in MLB history, with some predicting he would achieve this feat soon.
Post-Match Reflections: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts praised Ohtani's historic performance, saying 'he's one of one.'
Ohtani expressed relief and gratitude for achieving the 50/50 milestone, saying 'I was happy, relieved, and very respectful to the peers and everybody that came before.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Shohei Ohtani's performance was described as the 'best offensive game in MLB history.'
Ohtani's night could have been more legendary, as he was just a few feet from both a four-homer game and a cycle.
Others: Former Dodger Shawn Green called Ohtani the 'greatest player who ever lived.'
Miami manager Skip Schumaker showed respect for Ohtani, saying 'I've got way too much respect for the guy.'
